description: A massive gladiatorial arena in Dressrosa where fighters compete in tournament battles. The Colosseum features a large bronze statue of the legendary gladiator Kyros and hosts monthly tournaments for prizes.

keyEvents.title: Cavendish's Grand Entrance
keyEvents.description: Cavendish makes his first appearance at the Colosseum, encountering Luffy in the waiting area.
keyEvents.significance: The Colosseum serves as the gathering place for major fighters competing for the Mera Mera no Mi.

keyEvents.title: The Legend of Kyros
keyEvents.description: Rebecca tells Luffy about the legendary gladiator Kyros and his statue at the Colosseum.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the Colosseum's historical significance and introduces one of Dressrosa's greatest mysteries.

keyEvents.title: Jesus Burgess Wins Block A
keyEvents.description: The first block of the tournament concludes with Jesus Burgess revealed as the dominant winner.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the high level of competition and the dangerous fighters gathered at the Colosseum.

notableFeatures.description: A massive bronze statue commemorating Kyros the Undefeated, who won 3,000 consecutive matches without a single loss.
The tournament is organized into multiple blocks (A, B, C, D) with 137-139 fighters per block competing in battle royales.
A backstage area where gladiators prepare before their matches and interact with each other.

statusHistory.description: Hosting a major tournament with the Mera Mera no Mi as the grand prize.

culturalSignificance: The Corrida Colosseum is a major entertainment venue in Dressrosa and a symbol of the kingdom's gladiatorial tradition. It attracts fighters from around the world and serves as a gathering place for pirates, revolutionaries, and Marines alike.
